line_1: Tho' the skies darken, and the whirlwind raves,
line_2: And tho' the surging Tide's resistless waves

line_1: I shun the scenes where maddening Passion raves;
line_2: And unrelenting Avarice drives her slaves

line_1: "What's this I see! — my fancy raves!
line_2: " Three lovely forms stretch'd on the waves,

line_1: Could e'er believe the rage with which it raves
line_2: And calls his wild winds from their wintry caves?

line_1: When to heav'n's vault the fiery deluge raves,
line_2: To his own Aetna's sulphur-spouting caves,

line_1: Though strong the billows beat, and fierce the tempest raves.
line_2: He rose, high mounting o'er the heaving waves;

line_1: Though strong the billows beat, and fierce the tempest raves.
line_2: The other still his lovely burden saves,

line_1: O'er whose wild stream the gust of Winter raves,
line_2: Gleam in faint radiance on the foaming waves!

line_1: So, all confus'd, the hopeless Pilot Raves,
line_2: And yields, at last, to the relentless Waves.

line_1: And now much more he raves,
Of love and flames, and darts he raves.
line_2: The youth as frantic now behaves;
